summary: The Energy Workers Health Improvement and Compensation Fund Act aims to establish a trust fund, the Energy Workers Health Compensation Fund, funded by contributions from oil companies based on their highest-paid employee compensation. The fund will provide compensation for medical expenses related to asthma, heat-related illnesses, and other respiratory/cardiovascular diseases for eligible oil and gas workers and their families. The Secretary of Labor will also establish a commission to make recommendations on improving health outcomes for these workers, and report annually on the fund's activity.
